intro: Rubus caudatifrons, commonly known as the long-fruited blackberry, is a species of bramble native to southern China. It belongs to the Rubus genus, which includes many species of shrubs and bushes commonly referred to as blackberries or raspberries. The plant is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. Its fruit is aggregate, consisting of multiple small drupelets that form a dark purple to black berry. The plant thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks.
